definition[0]: a small raised area for a performer, speaker, or musical conductor to stand on
definition[1]: a high sloping surface for putting an open book or notes on while you are giving a speech to a lot of people â€“ some people think that this use is incorrect
example[0]: Several speakers took the podium (=spoke from it) that night.
definition[2]: to come first, second or third in a race or competition
example[1]: She was the youngest person ever to podium at the World Championships.
